newsitem.title: FRANCE: S&P confirms France Telecom debt ratings.
newsitem.headline: S&P confirms France Telecom debt ratings.

text.p: Standard & Poors said on Friday it confirmed the A-1+ short-term and AA+ long-term debt ratings of France Telecom following further details of the government's plans for partial privatisation and the group's results.

It said the government was now talking of raising 30 billion to 50 billion francs from a stock market flotation of a minority France Telecom stake in May and said its ratings of France Telecom accounted for the fact the the government was unlikely to cut its stake below 51 percent in the medium term.
In terms of financial performance, Standard & Poors said the operating result for 1996 had risen two percent to 30.3 billion francs despite tariff restructuring and cashflow was extremely strong.
It said it expected a big reduction in debt in 1998-99.
